chunks.text: Data Analysts turn raw data into reports and dashboards. They define metrics, clean datasets, and run SQL queries.
They communicate insights to stakeholders and commonly use SQL, Excel, Python, and BI tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Core competencies: SQL querying, spreadsheet analysis, basic statistics, data visualization, and business storytelling.
Behavioral competencies: curiosity, attention to detail, and clear communication with non-technical teams.
End-to-end analytics foundations, including spreadsheets, SQL, and dashboards.
Hands-on Excel analysis skills and reporting workflows.
Build a KPI dashboard from a retail sales dataset and present monthly insights.
Data Scientists build predictive models and run experiments to solve business problems.
They handle data wrangling, feature engineering, model training, and evaluation using Python, SQL, statistics, and ML libraries.
Core competencies: statistics, machine learning, Python, data wrangling, and experiment design.
Behavioral competencies: hypothesis-driven thinking, strong storytelling, and collaboration with product and engineering.

title: Machine Learning by Andrew Ng (Coursera audit)

chunks.text: ML foundations covering supervised and unsupervised algorithms.
Fast practical Python for data work.
Train a classification model and present model metrics with business impact.
ML Engineers productionize models and build reliable ML systems.
They design data pipelines, serve models, monitor drift, and collaborate with software teams using Python, ML frameworks, Docker, and cloud services.
Core competencies: machine learning, software engineering, model deployment, CI/CD, and monitoring.
Behavioral competencies: reliability mindset, system thinking, and cross-team collaboration.
Hands-on ML basics with practical exercises.
Production ML systems, deployment, and monitoring practices.
Deploy a trained model behind a REST API with monitoring dashboards.
Software Engineers design, build, and maintain applications and services.
They write clean code, test features, review pull requests, and collaborate across teams using Git and common languages like Python, JavaScript, or Java.
Core competencies: programming fundamentals, data structures, debugging, and system design basics.
Behavioral competencies: collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning.
Foundational programming and problem solving.
Create a CRUD API with authentication and unit tests.
